title: How to Make a Hot Water Bottle Cover from a Child's Top

steps.headline: Choose the cardigan or sweater.
steps.description: It should be from an infant or toddler, match it to the size of the hot water bottle. If there are holes or worn parts, it is probably still possible to use provided these parts can be cut off or covered up.

steps.headline: Remove the sleeves from the child's top.
Sew up the armholes.
steps.description: Sew up the bottom of the cardigan or sweater as well. Take this opportunity to sew any other holes in the top. If you've used a sweater, cut it down the middle and make buttonholes and sew on buttons or snaps.

steps.headline: Slip the top over the hot water bottle.
steps.description: Do up the buttons or the snaps to keep the hot water bottle on.

steps.headline: Use a ribbon to tighten the top if needed.

text: Choose the cardigan or sweater. It should be from an infant or toddler, match it to the size of the hot water bottle. If there are holes or worn parts, it is probably still possible to use provided these parts can be cut off or covered up. Remove the sleeves from the child's top.  Sew up the armholes. Sew up the bottom of the cardigan or sweater as well. Take this opportunity to sew any other holes in the top. If you've used a sweater, cut it down the middle and make buttonholes and sew on buttons or snaps. Slip the top over the hot water bottle. Do up the buttons or the snaps to keep the hot water bottle on. Use a ribbon to tighten the top if needed. See image in the introduction.
